style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">How do you create a loyalty program that truly resonates with your customers? And what kind of rewards <i>actually</i> work? Let’s dive into the latest data and insights on loyalty programs to answer these questions and more…</span></p></div></div></div><div class="false last:pb-6"><div class="max-w-5xl mx-6 my-4 lg:mx-auto"><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":null,"thumbnailUrl":["https://img.youtube.com/vi/TD3eZVPexFc/hqdefault.jpg"],"uploadDate":null}</script><div picture-in-picture"></iframe></div></div></div><div class="false last:pb-6"><div class="content-section mx-auto max-w-6xl xl:px-0"><div class="pb-8 leading-relaxed"><h3><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>Firstly - do customers actually want loyalty programs?</strong></span></h3><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">A recent survey by </span><a href="https://www.insiderintelligence.com/"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>eMarketer</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"> found that <strong>79% </strong>of consumers said they were <strong>more likely to choose a retailer that offered a loyalty program over one that didn’t. </strong></span><br> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">Plus, according to </span><a href="https://www.accenture.com/us-en/insights/retail/retail-sourcing-personalization"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>Accenture</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">, <strong>75%</strong> of customers are <strong>more likely</strong> <strong>to purchase</strong> from a brand that recognises them by name, recommends products based on past purchases, and can </span><a href="https://whitelabel-loyalty.com/blog/marketing-brand-activation/personalization-that-leads-to-customer-loyalty-examples-to-learn-from"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><strong><u>personalise their experience</u></strong></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"> - all of which are easily achieved with a loyalty program.</span><br> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">A well-designed rewards scheme gives customers personalised offers and incentives based on their behaviours and activities, which leads to high levels of engagement and satisfaction. </span><br> </p><h3><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>Do rewards and incentives actually work?</strong></span></h3><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">Yes, rewards really work - but only if you offer the <i>right</i> incentives. </span><br> </p><h3><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>Which rewards are right for your customers?</strong></span></h3><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">A </span><a href="https://www.paymentsdive.com/news/consumers-credit-cards-cashback-rewards-bank-of-america-survey/633402/"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>recent survey</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"> showed that<strong> 69%</strong> of consumers cited </span><a href="https://whitelabel-loyalty.com/blog/loyalty-industry-insight/why-big-brands-are-offering-cashback-rewards-and-you-should-too"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>cashback</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"> as one of their most valued reward categories. </span><br> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">A </span><a href="https://www.capgemini.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/dti_loyalty-deciphered_29nov17_final.pdf"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>Capgemini</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"> study also shows that <strong>63%</strong> of customers <strong>prefer</strong> loyalty programs that offer <strong>exclusive access to products and services. </strong></span><br> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">Finally, according to research conducted by </span><a href="https://www.merkle.com/thought-leadership/white-papers/2022-loyalty-barometer-report"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>Merkle</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">, <strong>79% </strong>of respondents prefer to receive simple <strong>discounts</strong>, whilst <strong>65% </strong>of consumers want <strong>free products. </strong></span><br> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">These studies show that <strong>each customer has different preferences</strong> - but generally <strong>customers want rewards that offer instant value, have a level of exclusivity, and save them money. </strong></span><br> </p><figure class="image image_resized" style="width:75%;"><img src="https://wll-cms.s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/reward_stat_chart_185ad83a8e.png" alt="Best rewards to offer customers in a loyalty program"><figcaption>What rewards do customers want?</figcaption></figure><p> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>Key takeaway: Give your customers what they actually want. </strong>It’s important to do research into your customers' preferences to understand what kind of rewards they find truly valuable. You can get them to participate in surveys or spend time collecting first-party data to get insights into what products and services they use the most. </span></p><h3><br><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>How do customers want to receive rewards?</strong></span></h3><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">Studies have shown that the most important factor in driving loyalty is not the reward itself, but the <strong>ease of redeeming</strong> it. </span><br> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">In other words, customers are more likely to stay loyal to a business that offers easy-to-redeem rewards, rather than those that require effort. That’s why it’s crucial to develop your loyalty program with the </span><a href="https://whitelabel-loyalty.com/blog/loyalty-industry-insight/how-to-improve-the-ux-of-loyalty-programs-top-tips"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>customer experience</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"> in mind. </span><br> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">A </span><a href="https://www.salesforce.com/eu/resources/research-reports/state-of-the-connected-customer/"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>Salesforce</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"> report shows that <strong>automatically applied rewards</strong> are the top reason why global consumers would use loyalty programs more frequently…</span><br> </p><figure class="image"><a href="https://www.insiderintelligence.com/content/how-retailers-capture-customer-loyalty-5-charts" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><img src="https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/vWa1Vr1ji8K1Qap3huanURUEMDXXIs2U0i0kz42-Nzg1Bv0_IfYIEcOBp3tRE-Y-raCzt93gQZjVqSafijKjkTLgAuN-FyMem-CRULFUp9Fw2QVRXTb_THbdBasGQ657fBgV9OnZYDv43rykzkp0mT4"></a><figcaption>Reasons why consumers would use Loyalty Programs more often: Salesforce</figcaption></figure><p> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>Key takeaway: Redemption mechanisms are just as important as the rewards you offer. </strong>Don’t make your customers jump through hoops just to redeem their rewards. </span></p><p> </p><h3><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>How do you create a loyalty program that customers love?</strong></span></h3><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">We already know that customers want <i>valuable, easy to redeem</i> rewards, but how do you implement these? To create a loyalty program that customers want, brands need access to </span><a href="https://whitelabel-loyalty.com/blog/loyalty-industry-insight/the-secrets-to-winning-customer-loyalty-whilst-protecting-data-privacy"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>first-party data</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">. This data gives you insights into customer shopping behaviours, preferences, and even non-transactional activities - such as how often they engage with you on social media. Brands can use this information to <strong>choose rewards that customers truly resonate with. </strong></span><br> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">For example, if you find that your customers frequently purchase a certain product, you could offer them a discount or reward for their next purchase of that product. Or, if you notice that customers tend to abandon their shopping carts before completing a purchase, you could offer them a discount or free shipping to incentivise them to complete their purchase. If you want to reward non-transactional activities and </span><a href="https://whitelabel-loyalty.com/blog/loyalty-industry-insight/how-can-social-engagement-build-brand-loyalty" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><u>grow your social media platforms</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">, <strong>reward customers who share your product on Instagram or TikTok. </strong></span></p><p> </p><h3><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>What's the number one reason why customers lose interest in loyalty programs?</strong></span></h3><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">A study by </span><a href="https://www.lendingtree.com/credit-cards/study/loyalty-programs/"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>LendingTree</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"> shows that the number one reason for customers abandoning a loyalty program is because the <strong>rewards aren’t worth it. </strong></span></p><p> </p><figure class="image"><img src="https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/Ppb-5EVTrnxr1Kgfp2KzbLJIztKa94QHrQzs1wrgYfGcTnlwANd1Kfxh_VN0jDINaaZItlZHjP0kFrHt4CeBsipT3i9Az1ezscAxtSsX_OOYiSfmEo2CMiMc6wQukCiyIRV9ajxeIH30wS1dr9C2-fk"></figure><p> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>Key takeaway: Providing value to your customers means more than just discounts</strong> - it’s about offering them a relevant experience based on what you already know about them. Use the data you collect to offer rewards that are actually worth it.</span><br> </p><h3><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>What you need to know about customer behaviour in 2024…</strong></span></h3><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">Customer behaviour in 2024 is changing. Consumers are becoming less loyal to brands and are more likely to <strong>switch</strong>. In fact, many customers who are part of </span><a href="https://whitelabel-loyalty.com/blog/loyalty-industry-insight/premium-paid-vip-loyalty-programs"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>paid loyalty programs</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"> have cancelled their memberships in a bid to save money. </span><br> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">You must <strong>adjust</strong> your business <strong>strategies</strong> in response to these changing behaviours. Lucky for you, we’ve gathered all the information you need to know about </span><a href="https://whitelabel-loyalty.com/blog/marketing-brand-activation/how-to-market-in-a-down-economy-research-and-expert-advice"><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;"><u>how consumer spending is being affected by the current cost of living crisis</u></span></a><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">.</span><br><br> </p><figure class="image image_resized" style="width:50%;"><img src="https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/yHdxjRESYjoUqAKzrqMbYdJM0LU55xJfdyNay_1-VnOwslHKSLec80WG2KWLKWOBGfrkrVlXkB1zrmno7w7NKHNH1R9NnKbdiED4F7lsSeBa7QZ-5qYLhO5XpJ1QshFFGvm6-190Yqn991vuLtU2kYI"><figcaption>https://www.dynata.com/the-new-experience-economy/</figcaption></figure><p><br><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;"><strong>Key takeaway: Monitor your customers' behaviours and understand what’s changing</strong>. More customers are cutting back on their spending, and this means a rise in brand-switching. This phenomenon makes it even more important to stand out from your competitors and offer real value to each of your customers.</span></p></div></div></div><div class="false last:pb-6"><div class="mt-6 px-6 pt-6 xl:p-0"><div class="mx-auto mt-8 max-w-6xl border-2 border-black bg-white p-6"><h2 class="mb-4 text-2xl font-bold uppercase tracking-tight text-black">Conclusion</h2><div class="leading-relaxed"><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">The key to a successful loyalty program is to offer rewards that <strong>resonate</strong> with your customers and provide them with a <strong>personalised, easy-to-redeem experience. </strong></span><br> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">By leveraging first-party data, brands can gain valuable insights into their customers' behaviours and preferences to create a loyalty program that truly adds value to their lives. </span></p><p> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">As consumer behaviour continues to evolve in the coming years, it will be more important than ever for businesses to stay attuned to these changes and adapt their strategies accordingly. </span></p><p> </p><p><span style="background-color:transparent;color:#000000;">By prioritising the customer experience and offering relevant, meaningful rewards, businesses can build long-term loyalty and drive growth in an increasingly competitive marketplace.</span></p></div></div></div></div><div class="false last:pb-6"></div></div></div><div \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.capgemini.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/dti_loyalty-deciphered_29nov17_final.pdf\"\u003e\u003cspan study also shows that \u003cstrong\u003e63%\u003c/strong\u003e of customers \u003cstrong\u003eprefer\u003c/strong\u003e loyalty programs that offer \u003cstrong\u003eexclusive access to products and services.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003eFinally, according to style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;\"\u003e\u003cu\u003eMerkle\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003e79% \u003c/strong\u003eof respondents prefer to receive simple \u003cstrong\u003ediscounts\u003c/strong\u003e, whilst \u003cstrong\u003e65% \u003c/strong\u003eof consumers want \u003cstrong\u003efree products.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003eThese studies show that \u003cstrong\u003eeach customer has different preferences\u003c/strong\u003e - but generally \u003cstrong\u003ecustomers want rewards that offer instant value, have a level of exclusivity, and save them money.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cfigure class=\"image image_resized\" style=\"width:75%;\"\u003e\u003cimg Give your customers what they actually want. \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s important to do research into your customers' preferences to understand what kind of rewards they find truly valuable. You can get them to participate in surveys or spend time collecting first-party data to get insights into what products and services they use the most.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch3\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow do customers want to receive rewards?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003eStudies have shown that the most important factor in driving loyalty is not the reward itself, but the \u003cstrong\u003eease of redeeming\u003c/strong\u003e it.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003eIn other words, customers are more likely to stay loyal to a business that offers easy-to-redeem rewards, rather than those that require effort. That’s why it’s crucial to develop your loyalty program with the \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://whitelabel-loyalty.com/blog/loyalty-industry-insight/how-to-improve-the-ux-of-loyalty-programs-top-tips\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;\"\u003e\u003cu\u003ecustomer experience\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003e in mind.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003eA \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.salesforce.com/eu/resources/research-reports/state-of-the-connected-customer/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#1155cc;\"\u003e\u003cu\u003eSalesforce\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003e report shows that \u003cstrong\u003eautomatically applied rewards\u003c/strong\u003e are the top reason why global consumers would use loyalty programs more style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow do you create a loyalty program that customers This data gives you insights into customer shopping behaviours, preferences, and even non-transactional activities - such as how often they engage with you on social media. Brands can use this information to \u003cstrong\u003echoose rewards that customers truly resonate with.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003eFor example, if you find that your customers frequently purchase a certain product, you could offer them a discount or reward for their next purchase of that product. href=\"https://whitelabel-loyalty.com/blog/loyalty-industry-insight/how-can-social-engagement-build-brand-loyalty\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003e\u003cu\u003egrow your social media platforms\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"background-color:transparent;color:#000000;\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat's the number one reason why customers lose interest in loyalty
